  • public class Blume
extends java.lang.Object
    Blume implementation methods.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void displayANSIRGBGradients()
      Prints out three vertical blocks of the possible shades of red, green, and blue using ANSI.
      static void displayStandardColorTable()
      Prints out a semi-graphical display of the available colors from the operating system's standard color palette.
      static <T> void print(T text, BlumeColor fg)
      Prints a string with a foreground color described by a BlumeColor object for 8- and 24-bit coloring.
      static <T> void print(T text, BlumeColor fg, BlumeColor bg)
      Prints a string with foreground and background colors described by BlumeColor objects for 8- and 24-bit coloring.
      static <T> void print(T text, BlumeColor fg, BlumeColor bg, java.lang.String... attrs)
      Prints a string with a foreground and background color described by BlumeColor objects for 8- and 24-bit coloring.

      Prints a string with a foreground color described by a BlumeColor object for 8- and 24-bit coloring.

      Prints a string with various modifiers for text color and display attributes.
      static <T> void printFromHex(T text, short... hexes)
      Prints a string with various hexadecimal modifiers for text color for Win32-based consoles.

      Prints a string with a foreground color described by a BlumeColor object for 8- and 24-bit coloring.

    • Method Detail

      • displayANSIRGBGradients

        public static void displayANSIRGBGradients()
        Prints out three vertical blocks of the possible shades of red, green, and blue using ANSI.

      • displayStandardColorTable

        public static void displayStandardColorTable()
        Prints out a semi-graphical display of the available colors from the operating system's standard color palette.

      • print

        public static <T> void print(T text,
                             java.lang.String... mods)
        Prints a string with various modifiers for text color and display attributes. No new line or LF is produced. Compatible modifiers can be found in the BlumeText class. Different modifiers are used between Unix-based and Win32 consoles. *
        Parameters:
        text -
        mods -

      • print

        public static <T> void print(T text,
                             BlumeColor fg)
        Prints a string with a foreground color described by a BlumeColor object for 8- and 24-bit coloring. No new line or LF is produced. Note: This method is only compatible with consoles which support ANSI escape sequence coloring.
        Parameters:
        text -
        fg -

      • print

        public static <T> void print(T text,
                             BlumeColor fg,
                             BlumeColor bg)
        Prints a string with foreground and background colors described by BlumeColor objects for 8- and 24-bit coloring. No new line or LF is produced. Note: This method is only compatible with consoles whichs upport ANSI escape sequence coloring.
        Parameters:
        text -
        fg -
        bg -

      • print

        public static <T> void print(T text,
                             BlumeColor fg,
                             java.lang.String... attrs)
        Prints a string with a foreground color described by a BlumeColor object for 8- and 24-bit coloring. Certain ANSI display attributes can also be used (e.g., bold, italic). No new line or LF is produced.
        Parameters:
        text -
        fg -
        attrs -

      • print

        public static <T> void print(T text,
                             BlumeColor fg,
                             BlumeColor bg,
                             java.lang.String... attrs)
        Prints a string with a foreground and background color described by BlumeColor objects for 8- and 24-bit coloring. Certain ANSI display attributes can also be used (e.g., bold, italic). No new line or LF is produced.
        Parameters:
        text -
        fg -
        bg -
        attrs -

      • printFromHex

        public static <T> void printFromHex(T text,
                                    short... hexes)
        Prints a string with various hexadecimal modifiers for text color for Win32-based consoles. No new line or LF is produced. Note: This is used primarily as an internal method for color table display and is not a cross-platform method.
        Parameters:
        text -
        hexes -

      • println

        public static <T> void println(T text,
                               java.lang.String... mods)
        Prints a string with various modifiers for text color and display attributes. This method produces a new line or LF. Compatible modifiers can be found in the BlumeText class. Different modifiers are used between Unix-based and Win32 consoles. *
        Parameters:
        text -
        mods -

      • println

        public static <T> void println(T text,
                               BlumeColor fg)
        Prints a string with a foreground color described by a BlumeColor object for 8- and 24-bit coloring. This method produces a new line or LF. Note: This method is only compatible with consoles which support ANSI escape sequence coloring.
        Parameters:
        text -
        fg -

      • println

        public static <T> void println(T text,
                               BlumeColor fg,
                               BlumeColor bg)
        Prints a string with foreground and background colors described by BlumeColor objects for 8- and 24-bit coloring. This method produces a new line or LF. Note: This method is only compatible with consoles whichs upport ANSI escape sequence coloring.
        Parameters:
        text -
        fg -
        bg -

      • println

        public static <T> void println(T text,
                               BlumeColor fg,
                               java.lang.String... attrs)
        Prints a string with a foreground color described by a BlumeColor object for 8- and 24-bit coloring. Certain ANSI display attributes can also be used (e.g., bold, italic). This method produces a new line or LF.
        Parameters:
        text -
        fg -
        attrs -
